definition: to dawdle/to go slow deliberately/to fizzle out/to have all one's hopes dashed/(Tw) to have a soak in a hot spring
puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces

bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions
surname Tang
rushing current
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled

sentences.english: Japanese macaque swims in a geothermal hot spring in the mountains of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 一只日本猕猴在日本某处山间温泉里泡汤。

sentences.english: The rain fucked up our plans to go on a picnic.
sentences.chinese: 下雨使我们野餐的计划泡汤了。

sentences.english: It’s not hard to imagine how such instability could sink a space mission.
sentences.chinese: 这不难想象如此的不稳定会使整个宇宙任务泡汤。

sentences.english: It rained non-stop for ten days, completely ruining our holiday.
sentences.chinese: 连续下了十天的雨，我们的度假彻底泡汤了。

sentences.english: A long soak in the bath would probably finish off your relationship.
sentences.chinese: 若在洗澡房里泡久了，可能你们的关系也泡汤了。

sentences.english: Therefore, our plan was an impossible due to the bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们的计划因为坏天气泡汤了。

sentences.english: It rained for two weeks, completely ruining our holidays.
sentences.chinese: 雨一连下了两星期，我们的假期这下彻底泡汤了。

sentences.english: Contrary to most reports, the deal is not yet dead.
sentences.chinese: 跟多数报道所报的不同，这项交易还没有彻底泡汤。

sentences.english: If they are not elected, Than Shwe grand plan is over.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们得不到推选，那么丹瑞的重大计划就会泡汤。

sentences.english: A proposal to honor the New Orleans cocktail known as the Sazerac has gone down the drain.
sentences.chinese: 一项表彰纽奥良知名鸡尾酒萨泽拉克的提案泡汤了。

sentences.english: By the time he's done with work, their plans are ruined, so they spend the night together in the museum.
sentences.chinese: 收工后原计划泡汤，他们在博物馆度过了浪漫的一夜。

sentences.english: But federal budget cuts threaten to zero out the work.
sentences.chinese: 但是联邦预算的削减将有可能使工作泡汤。

sentences.english: The heavy rain speak of the impossibility of the picnic this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 这场大雨显然使今天下午的野餐泡汤了。

sentences.english: A Japanese macaque swims in a geothermal hot spring in the mountains of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 一只日本猕猴在日本某处山间温泉里泡汤。

sentences.english: Bob's vacation plans went up in smoke when a crisis arose in the office.
sentences.chinese: 办公室出了问题，鲍伯的假期泡汤了。

sentences.english: The deal ended after a series of rancorous disputes.
sentences.chinese: 经过一连串充满敌意的争吵，交易泡汤了。

definition: to come to nothing (idiom)
to go home (in a ceremonial procession)/to return home
to fizzle out/to come to nothing
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1

definition: lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: to miss an appointment
(coll.) to be done for
to skip stones (on water)/(coll.) to squander one's money on a bad investment
to mess (sth) up/to foul up/to spoil
hopes are dashed
to be finished/to be done for/ruined/gone to the dogs/oh no
to plan/to intend/to calculate/plan/intention/calculation/CL:個|个[ge4]
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
to come to a decision/to fix on (a date etc)/to determine/to finalize/to nail down (a deal etc)
lit. froth and shadows/fig. illusion/mirage
